qas.question: What type of movements have tried to unite Protestant denominations?
Which is larger, divisions or unions of Protestantism?
What beliefs do most denominations agree on?

answers.text: common beliefs in the major aspects of the Christian faith

qas.question: What types of doctrines do denominations not agree on?
What type of belief defines what is a major or minor doctrine?

context: <a0_0>Various ecumenical<a0_0/> movements have attempted cooperation or reorganization of the various divided Protestant denominations, according to various models of union, but <a1_0>divisions<a1_0/> continue to outpace unions, as there is no overarching authority to which any of the churches owe allegiance, which can authoritatively define the faith. Most denominations share <a2_0>common beliefs in the major aspects of the Christian faith<a2_0/> while differing in many <a3_0>secondary<a3_0/> doctrines, although what is major and what is secondary is a matter of <a4_0>idiosyncratic<a4_0/> belief.
